junit@yahoogroups.com wrote:
> Elliotte Harold wrote:
>> I absolutely test exception classes and yes, I find bugs. Testing
>> them properly does require understanding some lesser known details of
>> Java's exception handling mechanism, especially related to how
>> exception chaining works. This is often where the bugs lie, and if
>> you aren't careful, you can end up testing the wrong behavior.
> 
> Do you have an example handy of a bug you've found? This interests me,
> because you keep saying you find bugs where I just don't find them, so
> either I'm not doing enough or I'm doing something magic I don't
> understand or I've been unusually lucky. I'd like to know which.

Ditto here!

Cheers, Ilja
